Fit convolutional neural networks with neural network library

Source: R/base_learner.R
fit_base_learner_cnn.Rd

This function uses torch as a backend. Torch currently supports CPU, CUDA, and Metal (Apple Silicon graphics), thus users can leverage available computational assets to accelerate the model fitting.

fit_base_learner_cnn(
  covars,
  dependent_name,
  independent_name,
  cv_mode,
  cv_fold
)

Arguments

covars

stdt. See convert_stobj_to_stdt

dependent_name

character(1). Name of the dependent variable.

independent_name

character(1). Names of independent variables.

cv_mode

character(1). One of 'lolo (leave-one-location-out)', 'loto (leave-one-time-out)', 'lolto (leave-one-location-time-out)', 'lblo (leave-block-location-out)', 'lbto (leave-block-time-out)', 'random (full random selection)'

cv_fold

integer(1). Number of folds for cross-validation.

Value

data.frame

Author

Insang Song

Contents

Developed by Kyle Messier, Insang Song, Eva Marques, Mitchell Manware, Daniel Zilber, Anisha Singh, Lara Clark, Cavin Ward-Caviness.
